subject: Politics
title: Triggers and Tipping Points
description: A quick, practical guide to Triggers and Tipping Points.

hook.text: A fruit vendor set himself on fire in Tunisia. Within months, dictators fell across the Arab world. One spark.

buildup.text: Revolutions need a trigger: a death, a scandal, an outrage that turns simmering anger into collective action.

discovery.text: Tipping points happen when enough people believe everyone else will join. Protest becomes self-reinforcing.

twist.text: Triggers are unpredictable. Regimes collapse over events they'd survived before. Timing and context are everything.

climax.text: Social media accelerates tipping points. Viral images of protest inspire thousands to join within hours.

punchline.text: Revolutions simmer for years and erupt in days. The trigger is never the cause.

quiz.question: What triggered the Arab Spring protests?
options: A fruit vendor's self-immolation in Tunisia sparked widespread revolt
A military coup in Egypt started the movement
